English just like any other language has
its quirks and idiosyncrasies that is to

say the language is not perfect similar
sounding words and odd grammatical

clauses not to mention the odd spelling
of certain words can lead to confusion

even for native English speakers today
I'm going to look at some commonly used

English words that even though speaking
English as a first language often get

wrong our first commonly misspelled word
is necessary

the word necessary is one of the most
commonly misspelled words in English

this is due to the use of single and
double letters within the word namely
the single c and the double s

our second misspelled English word is
definitely this is a word that catches

many people out mainly due to the sound
of a third syllable which sounds like

the letter A this leads many people to
mistakenly replace the eye with an A

remember there is no a in definitely
there is definitely no a in definitely

our third miss spelt English word is
fascination this word catches many

people out due to the occurrence of the
letter S and C being placed together

many people leave out the letter S
altogether whilst we are talking about

occurrence the word occurrence itself is
another English word that is often spelt

incorrectly occur has one R and two seas
occurred occurring and occurrence have
two seas and two R's

another commonly misspelled English word
is separate it is a common mistake to

add an extra e to the word by replacing
the middle a again the pronounciation of

separate can be misleading especially so
in this case as the word can be

pronounced in more than one way two
things can be a part or separate you can

separate two things which means to split
or divide separate separate our final

misspelled word today is psychology this
is a real stinker of a word to spell

because it contains not one but two
silent letters the P and H are silent

another good example of this occurrence

there are many words connected to making
